quizTitle: Sémiologie Dr. Nay Leang & Dr. Seng Serey

questions.question: Quel est l'aspect typique d'un hématome extradural à la TDM sans injection de produit de contraste?
options: Hypodense par rapport au parenchyme cérébral
Ne se visualise pas en scanner
questions.key: A typical epidural hematoma on a non-contrast CT scan appears as a biconvex lens-shaped mass.

questions.question: Quel est l'aspect typique d'un hématome sous-dural aigu au scanner sans injection de produit de contraste ?
options: Hypodense, en forme de lentille biconvexe
Iso-dense par rapport au parenchyme cérébral
Hyperdense, en forme de lentille biconvexe
questions.key: On a non-contrast CT scan, an acute subdural hematoma typically appears as a hyperdense, crescent-shaped mass.

questions.question: Quel est l'aspect typique d'une hémorragie intracérébrale aiguë au scanner non injecté ?
options: O. Hypodense par rapport au parenchyme cérébral
O. Iso-dense par rapport au parenchyme cérébral
Hyperdense par rapport au parenchyme cérébral
Non visible sans injection de produit de contraste
O. Difficile à différencier du liquide céphalorachidien (LCR)
questions.answer: Hyperdense par rapport au parenchyme cérébral
questions.key: An acute intracerebral hemorrhage typically appears as a hyperdense area compared to the surrounding brain parenchyma on a non-contrast CT scan.

questions.question: In MRI, the signal from water is:
options: O.Bright on T1, bright on T2
Bright on T1, dark on T2
Dark on T1, bright on T2
Dark on T1, dark on T2
Intermediate on both T1 and T2
questions.answer: Dark on T1, bright on T2
questions.key: In MRI, the signal from water is typically dark on T1-weighted images and bright on T2-weighted images.

questions.question: Quelle est l'unité de densité en scanner?
questions.key: The unit of density used in CT scanning is the Hounsfield Unit (HU).

questions.question: Quelle est la densité typique de l'eau en unité Hounsfield (UH) sur un scanner ?
questions.key: The typical Hounsfield density of water on a CT scan is 0 HU.

questions.question: How many layers of the cornea?
questions.key: The cornea has five layers: the epithelium, Bowman's layer, the stroma, Descemet's membrane, and the endothelium.

questions.question: The inner layer of the cornea:
questions.key: The endothelium is the innermost layer of the cornea, located closest to the anterior chamber.

questions.question: Normal intraocular pressure:
questions.key: A normal intraocular pressure typically falls within the range of 10-20 mmHg.

questions.question: How many layers of the tear film?
questions.key: The tear film is composed of three distinct layers: the lipid layer, the aqueous layer, and the mucin layer.

questions.question: Mucin layer of tear film is produced by:
questions.key: The mucin layer of the tear film is produced by goblet cells in the conjunctiva.

questions.question: The outer layer of retina:
questions.key: The outermost layer of the retina is the retinal pigmented epithelium, which lies against the choroid.
